SYSTEM: 3._Metodolog%C3%ADa-1-v1%28asun%29.pdf: Página 37
© A. Gómez Pérez, M.C. Suárez-Figueroa, B. Villazón
38
Ontological Engineering
Iterative-Incremental Life Cycle Model

The development of ontology networks is organized in a set of iterations

Each individual iteration can follow a different version of the waterfall model.

In the initiation phase the main outcomes are:

the ontology network requirements

the general and global plan for the development

No backtracking is allowed between phases

In the initiation phase of each iteration:

the revision of the requirements

the revision of the global plan

the detailed plan for the current iteration
speaker: SYSTEM
